result.execSummary:
All charges against Luke Blaine Anderson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Luke Blaine Anderson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke Blaine Anderson

records.addlTxt: of 3/7/22 IA filed by Trisha Carlson. eif

02:07 PM Defendant Luke Blaine Anderson in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 19CF201, 20CF83, 20CF9, 22CF35 and 19TR567 heard at this time. DA Hatch: guilty to Ct#2, 5-8 in 19CF201, dismiss/read in #9, 12-13 and dismiss Ct#10-11, 14. guilty to Ct#5-8 in 20CF83, dismiss Ct#1-4 in 20CF83. Dismiss 20CF9 and 22CF35. 19TR567 stip/order filed. DA Hatch requests a PSI. Atty Yonko and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#2, 6-8 in 19CF8 and Ct#5-8 in 20CF83. Counsel stipulate to factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, VOLUNTARILY AND KNOWINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds Defendant guilty of  Ct#2, 6-8 in 19CF8 and Ct#5-8 in 20CF83. Dismiss/read in Ct#9,12-13 in 19CF201. dismiss Ct#10-11,14 Dismiss Ct#1-4 in 20CF83. Dismiss 20CF9 and 22CF35. Court approves the stipulation in 19TR567 and will sign. Court orders PSI in 19CF201 and 20CF83. The State does not request the Defendant be remanded into custody. Court will not order the Defendant remanded into custody. Court instructs the Def to comply with the PSI process and to report probation today. Atty Yonko requests more time for Def to pay in 19TR567; Court orders a year to pay and orders credit for any administrative suspension. 2:25  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
from Judge Rohl to Atty Yonko's letter " This was completed within the timeline approved by the Court. The jury trial will remain on the calendar until the plea is completed"
from Atty Yonko re: global resolution with plea hearing set for March 25.
Plea hearing on March 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

09:06 AM Defendant Luke Blaine Anderson in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 19CF201 set for FPT, 19TR567, 20CF9, and 20CF83 set for HE. State's Motion to Impeach. Atty Yonko  objects; several convictions are old, requests motion be dismissed. DA Hatch disagrees; number of crimes Defendant has been convicted of. Court: convictions are dated but are relevant, grants State's Motion, number of convictions will be 8. State's Motion re: exclusion of victim; Atty Yonko filed a response to motion and requests victim be excluded.  DA Hatch names victims: 2 are law enforcement and a lay witness. Court grants State's Motion to exclude victims. victims to remain if they so desire. State's Motion in Limine: no objection by Atty Yonko. Defense Motion in Limine; no objection by DA Hatch.  Court grants both Motion in Limine. Court will prepare voir dire and jury insturctions and provide to counsel prior to JT. Defendant needs more time to understand procedure.  Court extends offer timeline to March 18th. Counsel to contact with Court and a hearing can be scheduled. 10:07
Status conference on April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center today for fingerprints and photograph.
No contact with C.J.K.

09:06 AM Defendant Luke Blaine Anderson in court with Attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has copy of complaint.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties. DA Hatch: $5000 signature bond with no contact with CJK. Atty Yonko and Def no objection.
